channel.title: Roots of jazz
channel.description:
Music-documentary series in 26 parts, covering various aspects of jazz.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Back to the beginning
item.description: This program looks back at the variety of jazz styles covered in the series.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Swing in small groups from big orchestras
item.description: A party in 1936 involving Benny Goodman and Teddy Wilson led to an informal jam session that became the Benny Goodman trio, later quartet. For the next five years, New York City produced a plethora of trios, quartets, quintets, and sextets.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Swing (Music)--History and criticism

item.title: Modern jazz
item.description: This program discusses the state of jazz in the 1950s.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Final formulation of Dixieland
item.description: This program discusses the "final formulation of Dixieland" music.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: New Orleans: King of jazz
item.description: This program talks about the ascension of New Orleans to the unofficial status of jazz's capital city.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: New Orleans: The early years
item.description: This program talks about the early development of jazz in New Orleans.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Chicago: 1920 to 1925
item.description: This program focuses on the period in Chicago from 1920 to 1925 when jazz particularly thrived.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: C'est la Congo
item.description: C'est la Congo: Is African music a prime influence on jazz?
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Big Bands: Hendersons
item.description: This program dicusses the development of big bands and swing.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Swing, continued
item.description: This program continues the discussion of swing music.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Swing (Music)--History and criticism

item.title: Big Bands: 1922-1935
item.description: This program focuses on the music of the big bands from 1922 to 1935.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Negro spirituals
item.description: The influence of African-American spirituals on jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Spirituals

item.title: Negro work songs and blues
item.description: The influence of African-American work songs and blues on jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Work songs

item.title: 1923-43 with Duke Ellington
item.description: This program discusses Duke Ellington's work during the years 1923 to 1943.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Small band jazz to 1930 in New York
item.description: This program focuses on small band jazz up to 1930 in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: New York (State)--New York--History and criticism

item.title: Jazz pianists
item.description: This program looks at the history of jazz piano and its greatest contributors.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Piano--Performance

item.title: Chicago: Bix Beiderbecke
item.description: This program focuses on Bix Beiderbecke, the jazz cornetist, pianist, and composer.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: New Orleans: White jazz
item.description: White jazz musicians in New Orleans take their city's sound out to the world.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Chicago: Austin High Gang
item.description: This program traces the activities of the founders of the Chicago school of jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Chicago: Oliver and Armstrong
item.description: This program focuses on the emergence of Chicago as a major center for jazz. Important musicians like Louis Armstrong and Joe "King" Oliver are discussed.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Piano: Ragtime to Boogie
item.description: This program traces part of the evolution of piano playing in jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Piano--Performance

item.title: New Orleans renaissance
item.description: This program details a jazz renaissance in New Orleans during the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Vocal tradition in jazz
item.description: This program explores the history and evolution of vocals in jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Bop and 1940s progressive groups
item.description: This program focuses on the music of bop and the progressive jazz groups of the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Up the Mississippi
item.description: This program explores the growth of jazz north from New Orleans.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: NAEB Regions III & IV: The Upper Midwest

item.title: Swing
item.description: This program focuses on the development of swing music.
item.dc:creator: Cleary, Norman
item.dc:subject: Swing (Music)--History and criticism
